question_paper.question_paper_name: IIT M DEGREE AN EXAM QDB3 28 Apr 2024
question_paper.question_paper_description: 2024 Apr28: IIT M AN EXAM QDB3

questions.question_text_1: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "DEGREE LEVEL : DESIGN THINKING FOR DATA-DRIVEN APP DEVELOPMENT (PEN AND PAPER/COMPUTER BASED EXAM)"  ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN.  (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)
question_texts: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "DEGREE LEVEL : DESIGN THINKING FOR DATA-DRIVEN APP DEVELOPMENT (PEN AND PAPER/COMPUTER BASED EXAM)"  ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN.  (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)

options.option_text: YES
NO

questions.question_text_1: General Instructions:  (i) The question paper comprises two sections. (ii) In Section A, there will be TWO questions. You are required to CHOOSE ONE question and attempt it; DO NOT ATTEMPT BOTH. Ensure that you write the question number clearly on the answer sheet. (iii) Section B contains multiple-choice questions, each carrying one mark. ANSWER THESE QUESTIONS ON THE COMPUTER ONLY. (iv) The total marks for the entire paper are 40
question_texts: General Instructions:  (i) The question paper comprises two sections. (ii) In Section A, there will be TWO questions. You are required to CHOOSE ONE question and attempt it; DO NOT ATTEMPT BOTH. Ensure that you write the question number clearly on the answer sheet. (iii) Section B contains multiple-choice questions, each carrying one mark. ANSWER THESE QUESTIONS ON THE COMPUTER ONLY. (iv) The total marks for the entire paper are 40

options.option_text: Instructions has been mentioned above.
This Instructions is just for a reference & not for an evaluation.

questions.question_text_1: Section A  CHOOSE ONE AND ANSWER THE QUESTION ON THE PROVIDED SHEETS ONLY.  I. Read the provided problem statement and assume your customer is in front of you. Begin by empathizing, developing a persona, and mapping out the user journey to identify problems. Analyze by determining the root cause and reasons for addressing the issues. Progress to the Solve phase by fleshing out ideas and creating low-fi wireframes/sketches on paper. Finally, demonstrate how your ideas address the problem and propose improvements.  Instructions: Step 0: Ensure that you write the QUESTION NUMBER clearly on the answer sheet. Step 1: Allocate one or two pages to personas, journey maps, and a list of problems. Step 2: Dedicate one page to identifying the root cause. Step 3: Allocate one page to identify desired results and summarize 2 to 3 'problem questions' to solve. Step 4: List the ideas in 50 words (not exceeding 5 sentences/ 5 ideas), in one page. Step 5: Sketch 2-3 wireframes of the product/service/app you will be developing, in one page. Step 6: Summarize how you'll iterate and what you’ll do for customers in the future to improve or expand upon the solution, in one page.   You may use the given sheets in portrait or landscape mode. Do not exceed more than 8 pages to answer the question.  CHOOSE AND ATTEMPT ONLY ONE QUESTION. Write the question number clearly on the answer sheet.  1. A. Many small business owners face difficulties in managing inventory, sales, customer relations, and marketing, often due to limited resources and expertise. How can you design a tool or service that streamlines these aspects of small business management, improving efficiency and profitability?  OR  1. B. Design: A Setting View and Single Detail View For: A Financial Goal Tracking App To Help: Early Adopters  Please read the following and enable it:

options.option_text: I've selected only one question from Section A and answered it on theprovided answer sheets.
Not Applicable.

questions.question_text_1: Section B  ANSWER THESE QUESTIONS ON THE COMPUTER ONLY.
question_texts: Section B  ANSWER THESE QUESTIONS ON THE COMPUTER ONLY.

options.option_text: Ok
Okay

questions.question_text_1: What is a key characteristic of a project?
question_texts: What is a key characteristic of a project?

options.option_text: Ongoing activity without an end date
Unique with a definite start and end
Always technology-based
Solely focused on product creation

questions.question_text_1: During which phase are the project's objectives and deliverables defined?
question_texts: During which phase are the project's objectives and deliverables defined?

options.option_text: Closing phase
Executing phase
Initiating phase
Planning phase

questions.question_text_1: Prof. Bala has linked the four phases of Design Thinking with which ancient philosophy?
question_texts: Prof. Bala has linked the four phases of Design Thinking with which ancient philosophy?

options.option_text: Four Laws of Thermodynamics
Four Laws of Creativity
Four Noble Truths
Four Thinking Hats

questions.question_text_1: What is the main purpose of conducting competitor research in app marketing?
question_texts: What is the main purpose of conducting competitor research in app marketing?

options.option_text: To replicate successful strategies used by competitors
To identify and capitalize on competitors' weaknesses
To understand competitors' products and differentiate one's app
To form partnerships with competing app developers

questions.question_text_1: Consider a scenario where a travel app partners with micro-influencers who specialize in travel content. What is the most likely marketing outcome of this strategy?
question_texts: Consider a scenario where a travel app partners with micro-influencers who specialize in travel content. What is the most likely marketing outcome of this strategy?

options.option_text: Increased app visibility and downloads from the travel community
Reduction in the overall development cost of the app
Immediate increase in the app's revenue through direct sales
Development of new travel features based on influencer feedback

questions.question_text_1: How does 'consistency in UX design' benefit the user experience?
question_texts: How does 'consistency in UX design' benefit the user experience?

options.option_text: By ensuring a uniform and predictable interaction pattern.
By frequently changing user interfaces to keep users alert.
By providing inconsistent responses to user actions.
By avoiding any recognizable patterns in the design.

questions.question_text_1: When a vertical prototype is developed, what aspect of the product is primarily focused on and enhanced?
question_texts: When a vertical prototype is developed, what aspect of the product is primarily focused on and enhanced?

options.option_text: The aesthetic appearance and visual design of the entire product.
The marketing and business strategy related to the product.
The environmental and social impact of the product.
A specific, crucial feature of the application, including backend integration anddata flow.

questions.question_text_1: In website development, how does the choice of platform (like Wix or Google Sites) impact the development process?
question_texts: In website development, how does the choice of platform (like Wix or Google Sites) impact the development process?

options.option_text: It mandates the integration of specific third-party services.
It guarantees the website’s visibility on social media platforms.
It determines the website's ranking on search engines.
It influences the ease of use, available features, and level of customization.

questions.question_text_1: How does analyzing conflicts in various narratives, like movies or novels, help in enhancing problem-solving skills?
question_texts: How does analyzing conflicts in various narratives, like movies or novels, help in enhancing problem-solving skills?

options.option_text: By providing an exact blueprint for solving similar real-life conflicts.
By encouraging creative thinking and application of theoretical models todiverse situations.
By shifting focus away from actual problems to fictional ones.
By suggesting that all conflicts have the same resolution.

questions.question_text_1: What is the next step after creating the customer journey map?
question_texts: What is the next step after creating the customer journey map?

options.option_text: Generating a list of problems
Conducting surveys and questionnaires
Developing a marketing strategy
Analyzing competitor data

questions.question_text_1: What is the primary objective of observing users interacting with a new or updated app in the Empathize phase?
question_texts: What is the primary objective of observing users interacting with a new or updated app in the Empathize phase?

options.option_text: To directly instruct users on how to use the app.
To observe, without influence, how users naturally interact with and respondto the app.
To convince users to provide only positive feedback.
To focus on promoting the app rather than understanding user exper

questions.question_text_1: How does the concept of 'light bulb moments' in relation to innovation reflect a broader understanding of the innovation process?
question_texts: How does the concept of 'light bulb moments' in relation to innovation reflect a broader understanding of the innovation process?

options.option_text: It shows that innovation is solely about sudden, unexpected insights withoutthe need for further development.
It indicates that innovation is a static event rather than a dynamic process.
It symbolizes the moment of inspiration that initiates a longer journey ofdeveloping and integrating an invention into practical use.
It suggests that all innovations are as straightforward and simple as a lightbulb.

questions.question_text_1: How does 'inspired innovation' typically differ from 'planned innovation' in terms of its genesis?
question_texts: How does 'inspired innovation' typically differ from 'planned innovation' in terms of its genesis?

options.option_text: Inspired innovation arises mainly from methodical research and development.
It emerges spontaneously, often fueled by a moment of clarity or insight.
It is always the result of a structured, predictable process.
It requires extensive market analysis before inception.

questions.question_text_1: State whether the following statement is True or False:  “The 5 Whys method is a problem-solving tool originating from the “Yamaha Production System.”
question_texts: State whether the following statement is True or False:  “The 5 Whys method is a problem-solving tool originating from the “Yamaha Production System.”

options.option_text: TRUE
FALSE

questions.question_text_1: When assessing the effectiveness of prototype modifications in the Empathize phase, what key aspect should be the focus?
question_texts: When assessing the effectiveness of prototype modifications in the Empathize phase, what key aspect should be the focus?

options.option_text: The extent to which the app's aesthetics have been enhanced.
Solely the technical improvements made in the app, independent of userexperience.
The number of new features added to the prototype.
How the changes have influenced user behaviour, satisfaction, and the overallapp experience.

questions.question_text_1: Consider a development team revisiting their customer journey map based on modifications made in the app's second prototype. What should be their primary focus in this reevaluation?
question_texts: Consider a development team revisiting their customer journey map based on modifications made in the app's second prototype. What should be their primary focus in this reevaluation?

options.option_text: To ensure the journey map aligns perfectly with the team's initial assumptionsand expectations.
To critically analyze how changes in the prototype may have altered keyaspects of the user journey and experience.
To make the journey map more complex to match the evolved prototype.
To simplify the journey map, remove any elements that do not directly relateto the new features.

questions.question_text_1: In product design, applying 'equipotentiality' might mean:
question_texts: In product design, applying 'equipotentiality' might mean:

options.option_text: Creating a product that adapts its performance to varying environmentalconditions.
Designing the product to perform optimally only under ideal conditions.
Ignoring environmental factors in the design process.
Focusing on enhancing a single performance aspect.

questions.question_text_1: In the third iteration of the Analyze phase for app development, what is the primary focus when observing user interactions?
question_texts: In the third iteration of the Analyze phase for app development, what is the primary focus when observing user interactions?

options.option_text: To validate the developers' initial assumptions without considering new userfeedback.
To focus exclusively on the most positive aspects of user feedback, ignoringany negative aspects.
To identify subtle behavioural patterns and underlying reasons for useractions that were not apparent in earlier iterations.
To implement changes based on the latest technology trends, irrespective ofuser feedback.

questions.question_text_1: When applying 'silent brainstorming' in the Solve phase, what is a crucial consideration for a team working on a project?
question_texts: When applying 'silent brainstorming' in the Solve phase, what is a crucial consideration for a team working on a project?

options.option_text: To ensure a wide range of ideas, encouraging diversity of thought withoutimmediate judgment or discussion.
To prioritize ideas that align closely with the team members' personalpreferences.
To focus solely on ideas that guarantee immediate implementation andsuccess.
To disregard unconventional or seemingly impractical ideas in favor of moretraditional solutions.

questions.question_text_1: Considering a mobile app with a diverse user base, how should push notifications be optimized for increased engagement and retention?
question_texts: Considering a mobile app with a diverse user base, how should push notifications be optimized for increased engagement and retention?

options.option_text: By sending the same generic notifications to all users to maintain consistency.
By limiting the frequency of notifications to avoid overwhelming users.
By focusing solely on promotional content in notifications.
Through personalized notifications based on user segmentation

questions.question_text_1: In the context of innovation, what is the significance of 'business viability'?
question_texts: In the context of innovation, what is the significance of 'business viability'?

options.option_text: Ensuring the invention only serves the inventor's interests.
Making sure the invention is economically sustainable and offers value overtime.
Focusing solely on the profitability of the invention.
Overlooking customer needs in favour of business profits.

questions.question_text_1: In intrapreneurship, why is it important to set criteria for idea selection that align with the company's existing competencies?
question_texts: In intrapreneurship, why is it important to set criteria for idea selection that align with the company's existing competencies?

options.option_text: To ensure the company ventures into completely unrelated business areas.
To discourage employees from contributing ideas.
To simplify the process by accepting all submitted ideas.
To focus on ideas that leverage the company's strengths and resources.

questions.question_text_1: An app is nearing its launch with several key features targeted at improving user engagement. What should be the primary focus at this stage?
question_texts: An app is nearing its launch with several key features targeted at improving user engagement. What should be the primary focus at this stage?

options.option_text: Rigorously testing and refining customer-facing features to enhance userexperience and engagement.
Finalizing backend infrastructure while assuming front-end elements are user-ready.
Overlooking minor bugs in user-facing features to meet the launch deadline.
Focusing on additional, untested features to make the app more appealing atlaunch.

questions.question_text_1: Faced with the challenge of designing environmentally sustainable products that also meet business goals, what strategy should a company adopt to address this design paradox?
question_texts: Faced with the challenge of designing environmentally sustainable products that also meet business goals, what strategy should a company adopt to address this design paradox?

options.option_text: To prioritize environmental sustainability at the cost of business profitability.
To focus solely on maximizing business profits, disregarding environmentalimpacts.
To alternate focus between sustainability and profitability based on markettrends.
To develop products with a balance between environmental sustainability andbusiness viability, even if it means slower market growth.

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following are considered features of empathy maps?  1. It is used to create a shared understanding of user needs. 2. It aids in decision making.  Select the correct answer using the codes given below
question_texts: Which of the following are considered features of empathy maps?  1. It is used to create a shared understanding of user needs. 2. It aids in decision making.  Select the correct answer using the codes given below

options.option_text: 1 only
2 only
Both 1 and 2
Neither 1 nor 2
